Detailed Description

MIME type description record.

An instance of this structure defines the properties of one MIME type.

Note:This structure should not be instantiated explicitly. Use the macro APOXI_DEF_MIME_TYPE instead.

Field Documentation

const CHAR* MimeTypeTableEntry::file_ext_substr_list
 

File name extensions associated with the MIME type.

Multiple file extension can be specified in one string. Each extension must be terminated by an extra '' within the string. The first entry is mandatory and serves as default file extension of that type. The extension string should be built using the macro APOXI_MIME_EXT Example: "jpg\0jpe\0jpeg\0"

BOOLEAN MimeTypeTableEntry::is_binary
 

Indicates that data of this type is considered binary.

const CHAR* MimeTypeTableEntry::mime_str
 

MIME type string, for example "image/jpeg".

MimeType MimeTypeTableEntry::mime_type
 

MimeType constant - must be system-wide unique !
